basics.name: Leigh Quince
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I was previously a teacher of ICT and Computing for 5 years located in London. I am now a web developer working in Switzerland. My main responsibility is leading the design, development and testing of our front-end products, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, require.js, Backbone/Marionette and JQuery to produce feature rich single page applications. In development I also make use of Mockjax to allow for a front-end first approach when developing. Tools such as Grunt help turning the development code into production ready code. In addition to my front-end responsibilities I am also working on our back-end, using Java, Spring and Hibernate to create our services, testing all development using JUnit and Mockito. I have also had the chance to develop for Android, creating an app to support one of our services using the android development studio. In my spare time, depending on the time of the year, I can either be found on the mountain skiing or in the lake canoeing.

work.summary: DomoSafety provides a homecare service designed for seniors to allow them to continue living in their own home. The core of the solution identifies potential risks that could lead to increased fragility and loss of mobility. The right people can have timely access to any change in state or sudden change in routine habits. The DomoSafety solution reaches out and connects the relevant environment of caregivers by displaying historical information as well as real time routine checks. No matter the distance, caregivers can have a simplified view accessible using mobile devices such as tablets (ipad) and smart phones.
highlights: In-house web developer playign a key role in developing products and services.
Front-end lead responsible for design, implementation and testing of domo-safety front-end products using backbone/marionette to create single page applications
Development and testing of back end services using Java, Spring and hibernate, JUnit and Mockito.
Development of Android App Domoinstall.
Agile development using SCRUM methodology

work.position: Teacher of ICT/ Curriculum Leader (ICT & Computing)/ (Acting) Assistant Director of Learning (ICT & Computing)
work.summary: Secondary education high school based on the outskirts of London with nearly 2000 students and a staff of more than 100
highlights: Assisting and leading a team of teachers in ICT and Computing across the Collegiate, ensuring the development of the highest quality of teaching and learning.
Developing a system to track and analyses student data across Collegiate to highlight areas of action.
Implementing a Computing curriculum within KS5 and KS3.
Development of Virtual Learning Environment and training of system within the Collegiate.
Training of ICT team to develop Computer Science subject knowledge.

work.summary: Investment group focused on property investment.
highlights: In-house web developer using PHP, MySQL and action script.
Adding features to existing system as required.
Prototyping direct debit system.
Creating design and analysis documentation in the form of use case and class diagrams.
Following traditional systems life cycle on small-scale features being implemented into the system.
